nodes.text: Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith: The Movie Storybook
Star Wars: Revenge of the Sith: The Movie Storybook is a young reader book published by Random House.

Three years have passed since Anakin and Padmé made their secret wedding vow. The Clone Wars continue to pit the Jedi Knights and the Separatists. Chancellor Palpatine holds a dictator's power, and the Jedi Council votes to arrest him in a last-ditch effort to halt the disintegration of the Republic. Over the chaos looms a secret plot by the Sith. Meanwhile, Anakin is plagued by feelings of powerlessness and dreams of Padmé's death. He seeks refuge in the tempting promises of the Sith, spiraling down the path to destruction.
The book includes the deleted scenes in the Invisible Hand's generator room and Yoda's landing on Dagobah. The book also identifies Tion Medon as merely a concerned citizen.
